snippet: A convicted member of Al Qaeda was transferred from the prison camp at Guantánamo Bay, Cuba, to his native Sudan — a first for the Obama administration’s military commissions system.
abstract: Pentagon announces that it has transferred Ibrahim al-Qosi, a convicted member of Al Qaeda, from the prison camp at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, to Sudan under the terms of a plea deal struck with military prosecutors; it is the first time a detainee convicted under the Obama administration’s version of the military commissions system has been sent back to his native country.
lead_paragraph: A convicted member of Al Qaeda was transferred from the prison camp at Guantánamo Bay, Cuba, to his native Sudan — a first for the Obama administration’s military commissions system.

headline.seo: Ibrahim al-Qosi Is Freed From Guantánamo and Sent Back to Sudan
headline.main: Guantánamo Prisoner Is Repatriated to Sudan
headline.print_headline: Guantánamo Prisoner Is Sent Back To Sudan
